pullRequest.title: Make the language reported via headers configurable
pullRequest.bodyText: See firebase/firebase-ios-sdk#6264 for the equivalent change in the iOS repo.

nodes.bodyText: Unfortunately, the method to retrieve the gRPC version is not public in the Java SDK.
Changing this to public requires annotating it with @hide in the javadoc so that it doesn't become a part of the public API.

Why not inline the string literal here?
Separately: this access should be synchronized, but since we don't really care about the results of multiple concurrent results of setClientLanguage, you can mark this field volatile to avoid the need for a lock.

Proguard will rewrite this method name in release builds of users' applications. We need to annotate this, likely with @KeepForSdk or possibly @Keep, though I don't know which applies to package-private methods.
Note that this method does not have to be public to be accessible from JNI (JNI ignores access control modifiers), but this can only work when the name isn't shortened.
The argument here should have a nullability annotation, probably @NonNull.
